title: [K-12] The Convergence of Art and Play: Innovative Social Studies Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic educational theories and knowledge of social studies curriculum content
context.additional_context: Pre-service teachers acquire methods to design social studies lessons by integrating arts-based and play-centered learning.

learning_goals: Designing a social studies lesson plan utilizing three art-based learning strategies
Developing a collaborative project applying five play-centered learning principles
Submitting an integrated teaching plan reflecting the interaction between art and play

Within a 6-month course, learners can create 3 types of creative instructional materials (quiz, interactive worksheet, coding game) using Google Docs, Canva, and Scratch in Chromebook/tablet environments and submit outcomes achieving ≥B grade (70–79 points) in ≥4 of the 5 peer evaluation rubric criteria (creativity, functionality, educational effectiveness, technical completeness, visual appeal).
Improving lesson design through peer feedback and self-assessment

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
